intro: Microlicia belinelloi, commonly known as the Belinello's microlicia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
